description: If the value provided to malloc is the result of unsafe integer math, it can result in an exploitable condition.

There are a number of conditions in which memcpy can introduce a vulnerability (mismatched buffer sizes, null pointers, etc.). More secure alternitives perform additional validation of the source and destination buffer
If a string is missing a null terminator, strlen will read past the end of the buffer
If a string is missing a null terminator, strlen will read past the end of the buffer

There are a number of conditions in which memcpy can introduce a vulnerability (mismatched buffer sizes, null pointers, etc.). More secure alternitives perform additional validation of the source and destination buffer

rule_name: Generic: Do not hardcode SSL/TLS versions within an application.
description: SSL/TLS version usage should be based on an OS or external configuration.
